name: Premier Inn Bristol City Centre - Haymarket

reviews.text: I was in Bristol for a concert at the Colston Hall. Bristol is also at a stone's throw from Bath, for sightseeing.
reviews.title: Better than it looks

reviews.text: After a bad experience at a Premier Inn in London, I was frankly dubious and had wanted to change hotels. As it turned out, this hotel served me very well.
reviews.title: Impolite staff

reviews.text: The good's:
reviews.title: I won't be rushing back

reviews.text: - England was in the midst of a heat wave at the end of May in 2012, with peak temperature in the 90's. So the air-conditioning was truly welcome -- the AC must have been relatively recently installed, as room literature mentions electric fans.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: - The room is spacious, with a very generous desk (although with insufficient electrical outlets.) There is a good amount of shelving space.
reviews.title: great room

reviews.text: This hotel is one of the modernised Premier Inns and you can tell. The quality is much improved and is to a high standard. Check in is automated but there are staff everywhere. Although not their franchise, the associated resstaurant was absolutely awful! Brilliant location - easy access.
reviews.title: Brilliant view from the top

reviews.text: You know what you will get with Premier Inn and this one no different. Easy check in, very clean and comfortable at a great price for the very centre of Bristol. Amazingly quiet in rooms for a busy city centre hotel. Had a great night s sleep
reviews.title: Great budget hotel

reviews.text: Very pleasant hotel in Bristol Centre. Car park a bit tight but ok. The attached Beafeater Restaurant provided a good value meal deal. Typical high standard example of a Premier Inn with all of the usual facilities and WiFi
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: Business hotel quality at modest price. Not budget but great value for money. Modern facilities, clean, very helpful cordial staff. Breakfast, especially prepaid breakfast very great value for money, less than half what other hotels charge for same quality.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: As is usual for Premier Inns, a very clean and well-run hotel. Friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, shame about the car parking

reviews.text: This is my second stay at a Premier Inn and I admire the consistency. Staff are friendly and helpful. I did not like the fact that the windows have a net curtain in between the double glazing so the view outside is blurry..I can't imagine why the curtains are there at all since you can't open the window to push the curtains back.
reviews.title: Very good for a budget priced hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only other nit pick is that if you want to print anything you have to email the front desk and they will open up the email and print your document. A bit of a hassle if it doesn't print properly and you have to come down, check it, then go back to your room and reprint etc. In my case it didn't work and I had a mini panic about printing my bus ticket..
reviews.title: Premier Inn Bristol City Centre - Haymarket

reviews.text: Aside from that, very well lodated; just opposite Broadmead shopping centre which leads to the Cabot Circus shopping centre, right in front of the Bristol Coach and Bus Station, 10-15 minutes walk to habourside..and a Beefeater restaurant adjacent to the hotel. Well that last bit is not adding value to the hotel because the service is appalling. The wait staff are friendly and trying hard but very short-staffed so long waits for everything.
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a very good location, close to everything. It is clean and comfortable and provides good value for the money. The only drawback is the fact that the windows cannot be opened, resulting in some "stuffiness" in terms of air quality.
reviews.title: Fabulous staff!
Value for money
reviews.text: Comfy rooms

While this Premier Inn may not be the most attractive building to the eye from the outside, inside it impresses. The rooms were clear and reasonably sized, although as expected, basic, but I found the beds to be comfy enough and had two good nights sleep.
reviews.title: A Very Good Premier Inn

reviews.text: The breakfast was great (we paid a little extra for the all you can eat full breakfast) and the bar area was very welcoming. I believe the bar/restaurant is actually a Beefeater, but it's internally connected to the Premier Inn none the less.
reviews.title: Budget hotel Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located; we traveled by car but there was a bus stop right outside the hotel and the center was easily within walking distance.
reviews.title: Premier Inn Haymarket Bristol

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in and check-out was quick and the staff came across as friendly.
reviews.title: lendi61

reviews.text: The only negative that really sticks in my mind is the lifts. I was staying on one of the top floors and it felt I spent an hour of my weekend waiting for, or in, a lift. This is of course an exaggeration, but with one out of three lifts out of service it was definitely more noticeable here than any other hotel.
reviews.title: Absolute joke

reviews.text: Firstly, this was on of the most surprising hotels I've ever been to.
reviews.title: Really Pleasant Surprise! Definitely Premium Service For Budget Price

reviews.text: I stayed at a Travelodge in Reading a year or so ago for work, and it is definitely not somewhere I'd recommend - smelly, grimy, and I even found pubic hairs in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Polite, welcoming and comfortable
Poor customer service
reviews.text: So from the outside I assumed Premier Inn would be of the same ilk (big grey concrete block) but was so wrong.

Firstly, the staff on arrival were incredible. There are self check-in machines in the main foyer, and immediately my partner and I were a little tentative. But a member of staff saw this and immediately came to guide us through it - at no point was she rude, rushed or over-bearing which is a real change. I've stayed at a lot of 4/5 star hotels in the UK and abroad, and this was honestly one of the best services I've had and we were both immediately at ease.
reviews.title: Always welcoming and great value

reviews.text: The bedroom itself was simple, fresh and modern. Both the bedroom and bathroom were spotless; the linen freshly laundered and everything very clean and welcoming. The extra pillows were a lovely touch and gave the bed a sumptuous - dare I say expensive?! - feel.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for - an excellent hotel.

reviews.text: Perfect for city centre visit, the staff were exceptional, the room spacious and very comfortable and importantly very quiet. Cotton sheets on the bed and a perfect mattress. Very good value for money
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to Bristol for a 2-day break. I was a bit scared by the building itself but the staff were kind and professional (without putting too much effort into it), the room was spacious and clean, and the continental breakfast was worth the price. Would definitely recommend it, we had a great time!
reviews.title: Very good surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bristol Premier Inn is very well placed for shopping and the car park is a boon if you can find a space. The staff are cheerful and helpful. The big "but" is that the mattresses are really really firm - fine if you like that, but not so good otherwise. To be fair, when we complained, the manager refunded the price of the room under the "good night guarantee". The windows don't open and there is a piece of net curtain between the panes of glass, so annoyingly it is not possible to get a clear view from the room. I wish they would put more furniture in the rooms! Only one chair, so have to sit on the bed to warch tv. Food ok in restaurant - usual stuff but not bad. It is wise to book a table if the hotel is full.
reviews.title: Mattresses too firm

reviews.text: We have stayed at a number of premier inns, when we arrived at this one, the floors were all being replaced so it looked a little dilapidated when we arrived...... but really good when we left.
reviews.title: well appointed good value

reviews.text: The hotel is located right in the town centre literally over the road to the Haymarket and Cabot shopping centres.
reviews.title: Central

reviews.text: The price was good, considering the lateness of the booking. The staff were excellent. Recommended.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: For me premier inns never fail,this one is nothing to look at from the outside,but the room we had was really comfortable and so quiet,the breakfast for £8.25 is fantastic,plentiful and really tasty,as for Bristol its self ,the waterfront is quite nice,Cabots circus is ok ,but apart from the Clifton area, most of it is an ugly mess.
reviews.title: premier league

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel with my 11 year old grandson. The room was of a nice size for the two of us as we had a double bed and a single. The location is great as it is right in the city centre. The hotel is nice as are the staff so it's a pity the breakfast let it down. The sausages were hard and the musrooms were tined. The marking on the hot water urns was so small that I ended up with tea & cofee in the same cup and I was not the only one.
reviews.title: Weekend

reviews.text: Over all we had a nice stay and if they sort out the breakfast I would recommend it to one and all.
reviews.title: Belated review from Xmas 2011

reviews.text: Usual great Premier Inn Standard, and a fantastic location.
reviews.title: nice hotel lovely beefeater onsite

reviews.text: Stayed at this premier in twice now (once paid for and once out of my own pocket). The rooms are spacious and of good quality, better than you would expect for the price paid. Breakfast was not included and although the bought one is extensive, I still feel it is less quality for money than the room.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wish the windows would open and an extra power socket or two would not go amiss.
reviews.title: Hen/Stag do central!

reviews.text: This is your bog standard Premier Inn. It delivers no real comfort, simply a bed a small TV a kettle (stuck to the side), a bottle opener screwed to the wall and the toilet paper dispenser is like one you'd find in a public toilet!
reviews.title: Terrible service and food and noisy!

reviews.text: It is fine for an overnight crash, but there is literally no comfort touches added to the room - I can't see how they could make it any more basic... although perhaps removing the picture on the wall...
reviews.title: Solid place to crash

reviews.text: The location is great, just around the corner from the city centre and all the shops/bars etc.
reviews.title: Deceptive but good

aka: Premier Inn Bristol City Centre (Haymarket) Hotel Bristol
